meanings.definition: Show or prove to be right or reasonable.
meanings.sent1: She justified her decision by explaining her reasons clearly.
meanings.sent2: His actions were justified by the evidence presented in court.
meanings.sent3: The detective's hunch was justified when he found the missing clue.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like a compass, always leading her to justified conclusions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise justified all the hard work the student had put in.

meanings.sent1: His hard work justified his promotion to manager.
meanings.sent2: The success of the project justified the long hours they had put in.
meanings.sent3: Eating ice cream for breakfast is not justified, no matter how much you love it.
meanings.sent4: The laughter of children playing outside justified the chaos in the house.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset justified the long hike to the mountaintop.

meanings.definition: Adjust the spaces between words in a line of type to fill it out to a desired length.
meanings.sent1: The typesetter justified the text to make it look neat and organized.
meanings.sent2: The document looked more professional after it was justified.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to justify the text, but it ended up looking messy.
meanings.sent4: The magazine article was perfectly justified, making it easy to read.
meanings.sent5: The designer justified the text to create a visually appealing layout.
